title: Palm Sunday, God #1 and the Voice of the Earth
description:
Rough Draft for Palm Sunday

For the audio podcast mirror on Podbean http://paulvanderklay.podbean.com/

To listen to this on ITunes https://itunes.apple.com/us/podcast/paul-vanderklays-podcast/id1394314333 

If you need the RSS feed for your podcast player https://paulvanderklay.podbean.com/feed/

https://www.patreon.com/paulvanderklay

Also on Lbry: https://lbry.io/ @paulvanderklay

Join the Sacramento JBP Meetup https://www.meetup.com/Sacramento-Jordan-Peterson-Meetup/

Paul's Church Content at Living Stones Channel https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCh7bdktIALZ9Nq41oVCvW-A

You can donate to Living Stones CRC to support this work here http://www.livingstonescrc.org/donate 
Donations may be tax deductible for taxpayers of the United States

transcript_parts.text: hi this is Paul and this is rough draft
for Sunday where I run through the
current status of my sermon that I'll be
working on for Sunday and it's Palm
Sunday this week now Palm Sunday
liturgically you have pawns you have
Jesus coming into Jerusalem it's always
a challenging sermon it doesn't have the
same kinds of focus that that Christmas
and Good Friday and Easter have and and
Palm Sunday is full of subtle irony's
because Jesus is welcomed as king but
he's not really welcomed and and he's
not exactly the kind of king that the
crowd is welcoming and and by Friday
they'll be they'll be shouting to have
him crucified and so all of these all of
these issues come together in Palm
Sunday and and it's not exactly that a
thing that you it's so easily packaged
every year into a nice sermon with with
nice applications and one of the things
that when when you deal with the text on
Palm Sunday is you all have so you
always have the long intro to this to
the what is that the the main point of
it with the hosannas and welcoming Jesus
with a cult after Jesus had said this
we're looking at Luke this year he went
on ahead going up to Jerusalem as he
approached beth phage and bethany at the
hill called mount of olives he sent two
of his disciples saying to them go to
the village ahead of you and as you
enter it you will find a Colt tied there
which no one has ever ridden untie it
and bring it here if anyone asks you why
are you untying it say the Lord needs it
those who were sent ahead went and found
it just as he had told them as they were
untying the colt its owners asked them
why are you untying the colt they
replied the Lord needs it and they
brought it to Jesus through their cloaks
on the colt and put Jesus on it and
that's actually the bulk of the text
pretty much every year and well what do
you do with this text now I think for a
lot of us the Colt story is sort of an
inverted Jedi mind-trick that that here
it's just amazing that the disciples
with this with this the Lord has need of
it get get use of this
which would of course be a valuable
animal for its owners and it's kind of
an inverted Jedi mind-trick because when
obi-wan says these are these are not the
droids you're looking for they in fact
are the droids they're looking for and
so it the Jedi mind-trick passes as a
lie but what the disciples say to the
owner is obviously and of course the
truth but but what the story is is is
sort of is sort of hard for a lot of
city people to understand because the
emphasis is made that this this animal
has never been ridden and and what that
means is that the animal has never been
broken and and these animals are not
weak and they very much know how to
launch a rider off of their backs and
you don't see any bucking bronco action
on this day now the story continues of
course as he went along people spread
their cloaks on the ground when they
came near the place where the road goes
down to the Mount of Olives the whole
crowd of disciples began joyfully to
praise God and loud voices for all the
miracles they had seen blessed is the
king who comes in the name of the Lord
peace in heaven and glory in the highest
now Luke Luke is addressing a Gentile
audience here so he dropped some of the
the the specifically Jewish content like
that content like the hosannas but but
what's fascinating is that what what we
do get is in a sense the conclusion the
inclusion of the angel singing at Jesus
birth to the shepherds the angel sang
glory to God in the highest heaven and
on earth peace to those on whom his
favor rests their heaven was wishing
peace on earth and now earth is finally
responding with peace in heaven and
glory in the highest and this this
presents sort of bookends this this
frames the entire life and ministry of
Jesus so far and and what this actually
shows us is heaven and earth beginning
to respond to one another in an
antiphonal way which is in fact moving
us towards and encouraging us towards
what the culmination
the Bible actually is which is the
reconciliation of heaven and earth and
and this is coming together on Palm
Sunday which is in a sense again this
very ironic coronation day for Jesus as
he is welcomed into the city of the
Great King as the king but yet soon he
will be rejected as king and then Luke
says this some of the Pharisees in the
crowd said to the teacher teacher rebuke
your disciples I tell you he replied if
I keep silent the stones will cry out
now this is interesting because this is
continuing on with the antiphonal theme
that we began with the crowds finishing

Jesus walks on water Jesus is the master

nature is red in tooth and claw but our
